meanings.definition: To influence or persuade someone in a positive direction.
meanings.sent1: She used her kind words to upsway her friend to try something new.
meanings.sent2: The motivational speaker was able to upsway the audience with his inspiring words.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's wagging tail seemed to upsway the grumpy old man's mood.
meanings.sent4: The colorful artwork had the power to upsway the atmosphere of the room.
meanings.sent5: Her genuine smile had an upswaying effect on everyone around her.

meanings.definition: A movement or shift in a positive direction.
meanings.sent1: The sudden upsway in the stock market brought joy to investors.
meanings.sent2: The community felt a collective upsway in morale after the successful charity event.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected upsway in the weather made everyone rush to enjoy the sunshine.
meanings.sent4: The upsway of support for the project was heartwarming to see.
meanings.sent5: The upsway of laughter filled the room with happiness.
